parsed.internal_thinking: Alice started at Node 20 (9-10-11: Wood-Brick-Wheat), which is a very solid, balanced opening. My priority is to secure a high-production foundation to keep pace. After analyzing the board, the most productive area is the cluster of high-number Wheat and Ore hexes in the south. Node 43 offers the highest total pips on the board (13) but is exclusively Wheat (9-6-9). I prefer Node 42, which provides 12 pips and a more strategic resource mix of Wheat and Ore (H[18]=Wh9, H[17]=O5, H[14]=Wh9). This establishes a powerful foundation for an Ore-Wheat-Sheep (OWS) strategy, focusing on early cities and development cards. I will need to prioritize Sheep and some expansion resources (Wood/Brick) in my second settlement placement to balance my economy. Node 42 also puts me in a good position to reach the 3:1 port at Node 50 to manage the inevitable Wheat surplus. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Settlement 1 placed at Node 42 (Wh9, O5, Wh9). Priority for Settlement 2: Sheep (critical) and ideally Wood/Brick. Potential targets: Node 12 (W3, B6, S5) or Node 25 (S4, O3, Wh8). Plan to expand toward the 3:1 port at Node 50.
parsed.say_outloud: Nice start, Alice! That 6-8-11 is a classic. I think I'll set up camp over here by the mountains—looks like there's plenty of grain to go around!
